text:
Nightly build 2006-05-26

There is a class cast exception there :

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.jmeter.testelement.property.NullProperty
	at org.apache.jmeter.config.Arguments.getArguments(Arguments.java:63)
	at org.apache.jmeter.config.Arguments.iterator(Arguments.java:152)
	at
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.sampler.HTTPSamplerBase.getQueryString(HTTPSamplerBase.java:499)
	at
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.sampler.HTTPSamplerBase.getUrl(HTTPSamplerBase.java:478)
	at
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.sampler.HTTPSamplerBase.toString(HTTPSamplerBase.java:584)
	at java.lang.String.valueOf(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(Unknown Source)
	at com.glowria.loadtest.controller.SyncController.next(SyncController.java:44)
	at
org.apache.jmeter.control.GenericController.nextIsAController(GenericController.java:129)
	at org.apache.jmeter.control.GenericController.next(GenericController.java:99)
	at org.apache.jmeter.threads.ThreadGroup.next(ThreadGroup.java:123)
	at org.apache.jmeter.threads.JMeterThread.run(JMeterThread.java:233)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

it occurs because getProperty return a NullProperty, and because you're making a
cast without testing the return value.

I think it should return an empty collection? 

Whenever, I don't know why it failed.
creator: glhez@glowria.fr
glhez@glowria.fr
text:
Created attachment 18370
my class + a bug sample
There is not CCE when the NoThreadClone interface is not implemented.
creator: glhez@glowria.fr

text:
I don't think this is a bug in the Arguments class - rather it is a bug in the 
class that is trying to use the class when it has not been correctly 
initialised.

The NoThreadClone interface was not intended for use with Controllers.
creator: sebb@apache.org
